intro: Hesperolinon clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's hesperolinon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its botanical features include a slender stem and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Hesperolinon clevelandii is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
